ygData.subject: RE: [EverQuest] Store bought JBoots
ygData.msgSnippet: Anyone know if the new Traveler Boots must be worn to cast? I know they are sold in Sol A Same vender and price as Tinkers Bag, 5,250 plat They have 1 AC They
ygData.messageBody:
Anyone know if the new Traveler Boots must be worn to cast?

I know they are sold in Sol A

Same vender and price as Tinkers Bag, 5,250 plat

They have 1 AC

They have 1.5 cast time

They are lore and heard no drop, not sure about this though.

Anyone here know if they must be worn to cast the effect?

Thanks!


-----Original Message-----
From: Su [SMTP:suceress@...]
Sent: Tuesday, May 08, 2001 2:24 PM
To: EverQuest@yahoogroups.com
Subject: Re: [EverQuest] Taunt Macro


Is the ability number the hotkey number or the ability in some sort
of list?
luv,
-Su

> I do not have a warrior, but I do have a bard that I made a track
macro
for and it should be a similar process. I think Taunt falls under
the
category of a doability. Here is a definition from a website I use:
>
> /doability # - Causes player to perform the special ability
specified by
number. For example, if Lay On Hands if your characters 4th ability
(1-6 are
the 6 general abilities, while 7-10 are the 4 combat abilities
besides Melee
and Ranged.), /doability 4 would perform the Lay on Hands.
>
> So, a taunt macro could go like this:
>
> /g Taunting %t onto me
> /doability 7(or whatever number it ends up being)
>
>
> The /g tells your group what you are doing. The /doability #
performs the
taunt. It should work. Good luck.
>
> BTW, here is a site one of my bard friends Tallies keeps up that
has lots
of good information:
>
> http://amtgard.pinkpig.com/everquest/eqcommands.htm
>
> Watch out for word wrap when you click the link.
>
> Robiinton Masterhealer
> Piemur Draggonsinger
>
> ----- Original Message -----
